basics.name: Spike Madden
basics.summary: Recently graduated from Oregon State University with a B.S. in Computer Science. I'm interested in fullstack development, machine learning and ai.

work.summary: Lytics helps enterprises automate personalized marketing experiences through the industry's most advanced Customer Data Platform.
highlights: Developed a backend web data extraction service using Node.js and Nightmare.js, a high level automation library running on Electron.

work.summary: TA for Oregon State University's CS 162 course - Introduction to Programming II.
highlights: Responsible for grading assignments and providing help through office hours. Helped design the curriculum over the consecutive terms.

projects.name: Interactive VR Fishing Experience
projects.summary: We were given to opportunity to work on this virtual reality project for Columbia and Intel during our Senior Capstone course. We were tasked with creating an immersive and interactive fishing experience. We used an HTC Vive and the Unity Game Engine to create our project.

projects.name: Portland Food Carts Web Application
projects.summary: Personal project that displays information on Portland Food Carts. The app is built with Flask on the backend with Elasticsearch for search and Mapbox with React on the frontend.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.summary: Personal static website created using Jekyll and hosted on GitHub pages. Resume created using JSON Resume and making changes to jsonresume-theme-elegant.

projects.name: Music Habits Android Application
projects.summary: An Android application that informs users on their music listening habits. The application provides a clean, Google Cards like interface to display information such as most played artist, album and song. The application was written in Java using Android Studio.

projects.name: Unbeatable Tic Tac Toe AI
projects.summary: Adapted a program that originally had a naive ai that would place moves randomly to become unbeatable. The ai exhaustively plays every possible series of moves given the current board. The code is written in c++ and is based on the minimax algorithm.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Students who completed at least 12 graded credit hours with a 3.5 or higher GPA.

awards.title: Engineering Expo Award Winner
awards.summary: Our group's interactive VR fishing experience for Columbia and Intel was voted as a top three project by Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Industry representatives based on technical merit and presentation.
